title: Novak Djokovic Leaves the Tennis Group He Started
summary: Novak Djokovic is a famous tennis player who has won many big tournaments. He helped start a group called the Professional Tennis Players Association (PTPA) in 2021 with another player, Vasek Pospisil. This group was made to give tennis players a stronger voice. Now, Djokovic has decided to leave the PTPA completely. He says he is worried about how the group is run and how it uses his name and picture. Djokovic wants to focus on playing tennis and spending time with his family. The PTPA says it is being treated unfairly because it is taking legal action against other tennis organizations. Djokovic wishes the group well but says his time with it is over.

background_read: Novak Djokovic is one of the best tennis players in the world, known for winning many Grand Slam titles like the Australian Open. Tennis players often join groups to have a say in the sport. The PTPA was created to give players more power and independence from big organizations like the ATP and WTA. When people leave groups, it can be because they disagree with how things are done or want to focus on other parts of their life.
